intro: Ouratea perseifolia, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, white or pale green foliage that resembles a misty appearance, hence its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are borne in terminal panicles. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
